body.p: The boards observed that the basis for this criterion is consistent with the rationale for using the ‘percentage‑of‑completion’ revenue recognition approach in previous revenue guidance in US GAAP. That guidance acknowledged that in many construction contracts the entity has, in effect, agreed to sell its rights to the asset (ie work‑in‑progress) as the entity performs. Accordingly, the parties have agreed, in effect, to a continuous sale (ie the customer controls the work‑in‑progress) that occurs as the work progresses.
